revised_title: Induced Morphological Changes in Bacterium lactis aerogenes and Enzyme Process Balance
tldr: The authors studied the induced changes in the morphology of Bacterium lactis aerogenes when exposed to different media. They observed that the bacteria formed snake-like structures under specific conditions and proposed a theory of balance and adaptive variation of enzyme processes in bacteria. The authors also discussed the mechanism of this adaptation using a hypothesis involving enzyme synthesis and crystal growth.
